item.title: Python Tips: On Getting Started, Unit Testing and Code Coverage
item.description:
tl;dr Here is a collection of useful Python tips, a starter “Hello World” Python template for both web (using Flask) and stand-alone script. And additional tips in writing effective Python code, getting started, Unit Tests and using the Coverage tool to improve code.

Getting Started - Introducing “Python Hello World” Template

Sometimes when we need to get started in Python, we need an easy “Hello World” template that gets us started with all the basics including unit test and coverage reports. I’ve searched and searched and I have not found something that fits my needs and so I decided to create one. I have placed it in the public domain for others to use under MIT license (free as water). If it solves a little bit of your headache, send me a note and share your feedback. Don’t forget to share the link with others. 😊

item.title: Python humanize time-interval without Arrow or Humanize libraries
item.description:
tl;dr Sometimes when we need to debug functions in Python, we need a way to write some quick timer code to capture the time-delta and to compute the time it took for the function to execute. This article shows you a quick and easy way to humanize a time-interval/time-delta without bringing in additional dependencies or libraries like Arrow or Humanize.

Elapsed Time: 2 Days, 5 Hours, 7 Minutes, 13 Seconds

item.title: uvloop - Python replacement for asyncio event loop
item.description:
uvloop is a fast, drop-in replacement of the built-in asyncio event loop. uvloop is implemented in Cython and uses libuv under the hood.

Benefits: uvloop makes asyncio 2-4x faster.

Cons: uvloop is available from PyPI but it requires Python 3.5. (The reason for this is asyncio was introduced in Python 3.4 and above.) Unless your project is based on Python 3.4+ - you may not be able to leverage this library.
